result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas S. Klawiter

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 8:55 AM: 21CF797, 21CF1367, 22CF882.
Defendant Thomas S. Klawiter not in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Thomas S. Klawiter.  Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Krave has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. Attorney Krave notes the Defendant was set to enter pleas today to the OWI 5th, but has recently acquired an OWI 6th.
State requests warrant noting the case is over a year old and the Defendant has had several failures to appear.
Court orders warrant and $10,000 Cash Bond but stays it to Friday 9/23/22 at 11:00 AM.  Defendant to appear in intake when picked up if Branch 4 is unavailable.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Case called at 11:06 AM.
Defendant Thomas S. Klawiter appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  State requests this case ride with the Defendant's other cases in Branch 4 on 9/21/22. Court so orders.
RTN:9/21/22 at 8:55 AM (Branch 4)

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
